channel.title: What kind of RAM should I get?
channel.description: I have a cheap Dell B110 desktop (http://support.dell.com/support/edocs/systems/dimB110/), and I only have 768 MB RAM atm. It's a pain in the ass when I have Photoshop and Dreamweaver open at the same time, because my HDD isn't very fast either, so the pagefile lags like a mother. So I'm thinking of getting 2 x 1 GB sticks of RAM. I'm looking at http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231098 right now, but I don't know if it's too fast for my computer, i.e. I'll be wasting money when the bottleneck is the mobo.

item.title: What kind of RAM should I get?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820227210

DDR 400?

And I could have sworn my mobo supports 667 MHz. Maybe the documentation is for a crappier model? Idk, I’ll check my BIOS tomorrow or something.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of RAM should I get?

item.title: What kind of RAM should I get?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

It is way to fast for your motherboard.

The RAM you want to buy is DDR2 800, your motherboard uses 333- and 400-MHz DDR SDRAM.

Looked around NewEgg and didn’t find any DDR400,

Thought I found 512MB DDR400 on TigerDirect,
http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=586829&CatId=147

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of RAM should I get?

item.title: What kind of RAM should I get?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

ninja nub:

Get as much as possible but for a good price, I got a emachine with 2gb ram for 500 bucks also with 250 gb internal memory.

You’re not helping. I’m concerned with the clock speed of the sticks and whether my mobo can handle 800 MHz, and what stick would fit it best.

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:3, topic:160981”]I think 2 Gigs is a good amount, also it doesn’t look TOO much only $50.
I think you should get it.[/quote]

I mean this as nicely as possible: if you’re going to tell me something a 5 year old could have told me, don’t post.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of RAM should I get?

item.title: What kind of RAM should I get?

item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

I think 2 Gigs is a good amount, also it doesn’t look TOO much only $50.
I think you should get it.
